reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night only and I have to say that I was quite impressed. We were given a double room in the annexe which was modern, clean and comfortable. The room was quiet, the shower warm and powerful and was ideal for a day or two. Lack of storage space might make it a bit on the small side for much longer.
reviews.title: A good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was reasonable - two sausages, egg, bacon, beans and plenty of toast. The staff were helpful and the location of the hotel makes this excellent value for money.
reviews.title: Good for location

likes.disliked: — The noise coming from the busy road, both traffic and people (only if you stayed at the front of the hotel)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Not our favourite place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in the city early, but went to the hotel, and they were more than happy for us to leave our luggage there while we went for a look around.
reviews.title: A little disappointing but adequate

reviews.text: When we went back at 2, we were booked into room 5. This was at the front of the hotel, right above the front door. On first impression it was a nice tall room, with an amazing floor to ceiling window. It was rather noisy though. And by the time the night came, the traffic was just as bad. You are right next door to a hostel so have big school groups staying there. So as well as the noise from the road traffic you have the noise from all the people in the street and coming back at all hours throughout the night. People also tended to stand outside and smoke, and the smell seem to drift up into our room. (The windows are the old style).
reviews.title: Good Location - small Room and Breakfast

reviews.text: I cam et Dublin at the end of March to celebrate my 21st birthday, I have been several times before and had stayed at a friend's house but decided I wanted to be nearer the action this time.
reviews.title: Everything was finae apart from.....
Glenn Guesthouse
reviews.text: Anyway me and my friend arrived on the 31st March and was staying for two nights, when we got to our rooms, we were pleasantly surpised with how big and clean it was with how little we had paid and was really looking forward to our stay. That night we decided to just go out for a couple of drinks and save ourselves for the Saturday, it was only about a 10-15 min walk to Temple Bar which we thought was great. Anyway everything was fine that night and the next morning, but we didn't get up in time for breakfast, but we weren't too disappointed. Then that Saturday we were all geared up for a great night out for my birthday, it was that great that we didn't get back to the guesthouse til 4:30, anyway the person who was looking after the front desk let us in, we then asked for our room key and he gave us a very puzzled look. He then said he would take us up to the room and he would go first, he then ran up the stairs, so I ran after him. When I caught up with him finally, I found him talking to a man who was sleeping in OUR BED!!! He was telling him to get out and that he wouldn't charge him etc and the man was becoming quite violent, after about 5 min of shouting the man finally left and the night porter disappeared also, we didn't know what to do, the night porter then came up didn't bother saying sorry or what had happened, just gave us some clean sheet for US to change and just said the man cam ein saying he had a room and he spotted that only our key was left.

The last time I stayed in Dublin, it was in a wonderful B&B that was about 15 minutes bus ride from the city centre. This time around, I wanted somewhere centrally located. The Glen Guesthouse is a 5-minute walk from the city centre and has pretty nice views of the city from the 5th floor bedroom windows. But that is where the positive attributes of this establishment end.
reviews.title: Absolutely dreadful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First off, the service here is horrible. The front desk person was cold and rude. She couldn't care less about us being there. When we finally paid for our rooms, we carried our luggage up 5 flights of stairs to the top floor. The rooms were quite spacious, but they both STUNK. One smelled like cigarettes and the other like cigarettes masked by a gallon of ammonia. Gross.
reviews.title: nice rooms, shame about the staff!

likes.disliked: — The rude woman on reception & the breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needless to say, we didn't spend a whole lot of time in the rooms. We hit the town, giving our key to the front desk person, which didn't sit well with us. When we came back laterin the evening we told the night porter our room numbers, and he gave us our keys -- no IDs checked, no questions asked. From another review I read on TripAdvisor, this is a recipe for disaster.
reviews.title: Nice stay at Glen Guesthouse
Dublin's Fair City
reviews.text: The next morning we tried to take a shower and the drain was clogged. Luckily, my fellow travel companions' shower in the other room worked (although the toilet seat was broken!). Upon leaving the guesthouse for the day we told the front desk person about the shower and she said they would fix it. The next morning, nothing. Still broken. We told them again, and they never did anything about it. No working shower. Nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another night they didn't bring us new towels. We called and had the night porter bring some up. When he gave us the towels, he saw our friends from the next room in there with us. We were having tea and playing cards. Five minutes later, he calls up and asks why there were 4 people in the room, when we had paid for only 2. Ridiculous!
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!

likes.disliked: — Room could have been larger. More storage space. Better view (basement room)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Glen Guesthouse for 2 nights. Good value for the money for a centrally located hotel. Something to keep in mind:
reviews.title: Good place for a low maintenance traveller

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1.Rooms are not equipped with the following items- alarm clocks, hairdryers and irons, because staff kept losing them to previous guests. But they may have them at the front desk. However, rooms are clean and do have coffeemakers with well stocked coffee/tea and televisions with 6 local channels.
reviews.title: Basic but liveable...close to city centre

reviews.text: 2. Payment is expected upfront and credit cards without a security chip can not be processed.
reviews.title: first impressions!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Fine accommodation
reviews.text: 3. Front desk is open 24 hours, you have to buzz to get in after hours. A key has to be left at front desk each time you leave a hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the staff was quite friendly. The lady working at the front desk not only booked a cab for us, but also arranged a wake up call.
reviews.title: Average
